newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end mixed, blue chips falter.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end mixed, blue chips falter.

text.p: Buyers stepped away from Kuala Lumpur blue chips on Friday, but second liners continued to pull in bids after Tuesday's sharp spill.

Cautioned by a nearly 50-point dive in the Dow overnight and the approaching U.S. monthly employment data, which was due out at 1230 GMT, institutional buyers of main counters largely stayed on the sidelines.

The key Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange Composite Index ended off 2.16 points to 1,105.33. Meanwhile, the Second Board index surged 11.16 points to 554.39 at the close, after hitting a new intraday high of 554.84.
Volume was over 219 million shares, and gainers led losers 330 to 209.
While the market was hit with a slew of corporate news, including corporate earnings reports, dealers said investors had largely discounted the information.
"It's all been expected," said one market analyst.

William Chan, an institutional dealer with Seagroatt and Campbell, said, "It's the (U.S.) jobs (report) that is worrying. If things are going too fast, we can expect an interest rate hike." A Reuter survey calls for August payrolls to rise 244,000 versus a 193,000 gain in July.
